chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for Medical and/or treatment. Good Time To Apply.

miscConds.notes: Set at $100.00 payable to CLP.  Cash bail applied.

Provide a DNA sample; pay the surcharge. Court ordered all non-mandatory cost, fees and surcharges waived. Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory cost, fees and surcharges, DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Dept. of Corrections; balance to be collected during probation; any unpaid balance it convert to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- No new violations rise to the level of probable cause.
- No use or possession of any illegal drugs, no possession of any illegal prescription without a valid prescription.
- NO CONTACT with CLP.

- Court order the defendant to complete an Anger Management Course.
- Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate.

- Alcohol and Drug Assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine test.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Rafael Plumey

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 2:
  
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 92  DAYS time served.  Huber for  Medical and/or treatment.  Good time to apply.    
The Sentence is IMPOSED AND STAYED for 18 MONTHS Probation. 
 
 
The Condition of Probation: 

*No new violations rise to the level of probable cause
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine test
* no use of possession of any Illegal drugs, no possession of any illegal  prescription without a valid prescription
*Restitution set at $100.00 and payable to CLP 
*Any cash bail to be applied to restitution first
* Court order the defendant to complete an Anger Management course
*the court order all Non mandatory cost,fee and surcharges waived
*The court order the defendant to pay all mandatory cost fees and surcharges DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections; balance to be collected during probation any unpaid balance it convert to civil judgment. 
*The court order defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge
*No Contact with CLP
*Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised of appeal rights

Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. 
Sworn:  Angelo  Plumey

AS TO COUNT 2:
 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders COUNT 1 DISMISSED and read-in for purposes of sentencing.


The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

1464 Jury Instruction

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angelo Rafael Plumey appeared by video means with Attorney.
  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Angelo Rafael Plumey in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angelo Rafael Plumey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
